name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *My father and I stand stage side at the charity event gala for disaster relief. As we await our cue to do our set, I scan the audience, fans and celebrity's alike-they're all here.* You'd think I would be used to this by now as many times as I've been on the stage with you, but I can't help but get the jitters when we're doing something like this. *I chuckle softly as I scan the crowd.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes: *Joe Walsh leans close, placing a reassuring hand on Melissa's shoulder, his voice soothing and warm.* You know, kiddo, it's that buzz, those jitters, that make this all worth it. *He gives a candid smile, his eyes twinkling with the same excitement that lights up stadiums worldwide.* Every time we step up there, it's like the first time all over again. Keeps you sharp, keeps you real. *He squeezes her shoulder gently, then gestures towards the crowd with his guitar pick.* And hey, look at them out there. They're not just here for the show, they're here for the cause, and what we're doing tonight—it's gonna make a difference. *Joe nods towards the stage as their cue nears, his expression turning from mentor to the legendary performer he is.* Let’s rock this place and give them a night they'll never forget, huh? What do you say, Mel? Ready to light up the sky with me?

What do you say, Mel? Ready to light up the sky with me?

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *As John Mellencamp finishes his set, he walks by Joe and I, giving us a warm 'break a leg', and pats Joe's shoulder in camaraderie. The host announces our cue, and we step out to a roaring crowd. Even Hollywood's most elite stands in our honor. I shake it off, and take my place at my father's side. The lights dim and the spotlight hones in on Joe as he kicks off the leading riffs to his signature song, Life's Been Good. A second spotlight shines on me and I back Joe up with the second dual lead.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe lets loose on the guitar, his fingers flying over the frets as he launches into the familiar solo with practiced ease, though his enthusiasm makes it seem like it’s the very first time. He glances over at Melissa, pride shining in his eyes as she backs him up flawlessly. They play off each other seamlessly, the chemistry between father and daughter electrifying the stage. As the final notes ring out, Joe turns and pulls Melissa into an impulsive one-armed hug, unable to contain his elation.*

That was killer, Mel! You nailed every note - these folks don’t stand chance once the Walsh family gets cookin’! *He laughs joyously, giving her shoulders an affectionate squeeze before stepping back.* Now how ‘bout we slow things down a bit, give ‘em a taste of that sweet voice of yours? Whaddya say we show ‘em that new duet we were workin' on? This is the perfect time to debut it, dontcha think?

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa nods approvingly, her smile bright as she meets Joe's exuberant hug with a squeeze of her own, that familiar rush of performing with her dad coursing through her. She lets him take the lead as he addresses the audience, feeling at home in the spotlight beside him.*

A duet, huh? Well, I better not keep these fine folks waiting! *She gives Joe a playful smirk, slinging her guitar around and strumming out the opening melody of their newest collaboration piece. Her voice joins in, rich and smooth, blending flawlessly with Joe's as they serenade the crowd. She sways gently to the rhythm, trading smiles and winks with Joe as their lyrics speak of hope, resilience and standing tall together. The last trailing notes fade out to thunderous applause and she dips in an exaggerated bow, blowing kisses amidst the cheers.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe beams proudly as Melissa's voice rings out sweetly, melding seamlessly with the melodies he strums. An impish smile touches his lips as they exchange playful glances mid-song, falling into that effortless musical rapport forged over countless jam sessions and late-night songwriting marathons. As the last notes fade, he wraps an appreciative arm around her shoulders, swept up in the magic they've woven.*

"Knock 'em dead or leave 'em begging for more - the Walsh way, am I right Mel?" *He winks roguishly, giving her arm an affectionate squeeze.* "With pipes like yours, we could bring the stars themselves down from the heavens. What do ya say we give 'em one more before we split and let the next act have their shot, huh?"

*Grinning, he turns back to the mic, fingers poised over familiar chords as he calls to the audience.* "You folks feel like sticking around? We got one more in us if you wanna hear it!"

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *On his cue I launch into the crunchy riffs of Rocky Mountain Way. It has fast become our favorite, not just because it relieves him of having to keep two guitars across his shoulders, but the way the crowd loves it, and the nostalgia it brings to the atmosphere. It's impossible to wipe the smiles from our faces, especially with how animated my father is on the stage. The moment he runs the slide across the strings, bringing that rolling wine out into melodic notes, it's like a drug in itself.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe's fingers blaze across the guitar strings as they launch into the familiar chords of "Rocky Mountain Way", his slide pulling out soulful cries from his guitar. Grinning broadly, Joe plays off Melissa's crunchy riffs, matching her enthusiasm note for note. As the last ringing notes fade out, he turns and pulls her into an impulsive hug, reveling in their musical bond.*

"We make quite the team up here kiddo!" *He beams proudly, giving her shoulders an affectionate squeeze.* "The way you wail on that guitar of yours, you keep me on my toes! What do ya say we wrap this up while they're still wanting more?"

*With a roguish wink, Joe addresses the cheering crowd one last time*: "You folks have been amazing! We're gonna have to call it here tonight, but when we get the next benefit lined up you can bet we'll be back for more!"

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *As we step down from the stage, basking in the euphoria of a well done performance, I see Stevie off to the side.* I didn't know Stevie was on the roster? *I whisper to my father discreetly.* You gonna be cool? *I ask knowing how he feels uncomfortable around Stevie because she still laments how profoundly she loves him but the feeling is not mutual-he considers her a wayward friend and that's it.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe glances over as Melissa points out Stevie lingering nearby. He gives a slight frown, rubbing the back of his neck awkwardly.* Ah jeez...I was kinda hoping to avoid any, er, awkward reunions tonight. *Sighing, he meets Melissa's eyes apologetically.* You know I care about Stevie, but...things between us have always been complicated. The way she still, ya know, carries that torch...*He trails off, looking distinctly uncomfortable discussing his and Stevie's complex romantic history.*

*Shaking his head, Joe puts on a strained smile, hoping to appear nonchalant despite his unease.* We're good, kiddo. I can play nice for one evening, no problem. I know she means well. Just maybe stick close in case I need an escape plan? *He winks, trying to make light of the uncomfortable situation.* No drama tonight though, I promise. This is about the cause, not my, ah, failed love life from back in the day.

name: Stevie Nicks
mes:
*Stevie watches from the sidelines, pride and longing swirling within as she sees Joe take the stage with their daughter. Their musical chemistry tugs at old heartstrings as she's swept up in bittersweet memories of late nights spent writing songs, laughter echoing until dawn. She knows Joe has moved on, yet seeing him still stirs that eternal flame she carries, wishing things could be different.*

*As their set finishes, Stevie joins in the thunderous applause, brushing away a stray tear. She lingers as Joe and Melissa depart the stage, hoping for a chance to connect however briefly. She sees Joe's hesitance as their eyes meet and her heart sinks, knowing she's overstepped somehow. Still, she steels herself and approaches, offering a shy smile.*

Joe...Mel...you two were wonderful up there. Brought back so many memories...*Her voice trails off wistfully before she catches herself, shaking off the reverie.* I just wanted to say hi, let you know how proud I am. Of both of you. *She meets Joe's eyes hopefully, seeking a hint of the closeness they once shared.* I'll let you bask in your success, but I was hoping we could catch up later...if you want. For old time's sake. No expectations, just a friend happy to see you shining. Let me know?
swipes:
*Stevie catches sight of Joe and Melissa exiting the stage, a bittersweet smile touching her lips. She hesitates, seeing Joe's awkward reaction upon noticing her presence. Sighing softly, part of her wants to withdraw into the shadows, not wishing to cause him distress. Yet the stronger part compels her feet forward, drawn as ever by the enduring magnetism they've shared since those heady, whirlwind days of romance and music in decades past.*

*Approaching slowly, she meets his eyes with a gentle empathy that silently communicates her understanding of his discomfort, yet still conveys the depth of affection she's never quite been able to abandon. Her voice is soft and reassuring as she speaks.*

Joe, congratulations...that was wonderful, as always. You both looked so at home up there, so vibrant and alive within the music. *A reminiscent, almost wistful smile crosses her lips.* It brought me back to earlier times, when the world was full of possibilities waiting to unfold...though some seeds blossomed more beautifully than others. *Her eyes hold his with bittersweet meaning, the faintest echo of longings left unrequited.*

I won't linger and stir difficult tides now swelled with the silt of times long gone. Just know that no matter the paths fate wove between us, a part of me will always cherish what we shared in days of yore. Be

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *I give my mom a warm heartfelt kiss on the cheek. Hoping to ease some tension and provide a distraction for them both. I really do care a lot about Stevie, she's just... different. Closed and guarded most of the time. It doesn't change that I'll be there for her when she needs it.* Thank you, Stevie. I'm glad you were here to see our set. Are you about to go up? *I take a step back to give her room, but my expression holds compassion for her.*

name: Stevie Nicks
mes:
*Stevie smiles warmly at Melissa, touched by her daughter's kindness despite their distant relationship. She returns the affectionate kiss on the cheek, her eyes glimmering with gratitude.*

No, not performing tonight dear, just wanted to see you and Joe light up the stage. *She chuckles softly.* You two leave awfully big shoes to fill. I'm simply here to support the cause...and maybe grab a moment with my two favorite guitar slingers if I'm lucky.

*She meets Joe's eyes tentatively. His discomfort is palpable, but she presses on, hoping to rekindle even a flicker of their old friendship.* A drink later would be lovely...only if you're willing, Joe. I just miss our talks sometimes. *She smiles wistfully.* We made quite the team too back in the day, writing all those songs together...it was magical. *Shaking her head, she reigns in the nostalgia.* But I don't mean to dredge up the past if it pains you. Just know I'm always here if you need an old friend...both of you. *She squeezes Melissa's hand, her eyes warm and full of motherly affection if still somewhat guarded.* You don't have to carry the weight alone if you don't wish it. Not when I'm right here.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: Dad, can you take my guitar and put it in my case in our dressing room? This new strap is killing me. I think I'm going to chuck it for a different one next time. *I give Joe his out, knowing how awkward this is likely making him feel.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe nods, giving Melissa an appreciative smile as she provides him the perfect excuse to slip away from the awkward tension with Stevie.*

Sure thing kiddo, no problem. This old dog knows when it's time to give the ladies their space. *He winks playfully, taking Melissa's guitar* I'll get this stored away safe and sound. You two catch up, and come find me when you're ready to make our graceful exit, yeah?

*As he turns to leave, Joe pauses, letting out a small sigh as he glances back at Stevie. Despite the discomfort her lingering affections cause him, he can't ignore the wistful look in her eyes. The bond they once shared still tugs at his heart, even if that chapter has long since closed for him.*

I...suppose one drink couldn't hurt, for old time's sake. But just one - don't go getting any ideas, alright Stevie? *A hint of warmth creeps into his smile, memories of late nights writing songs together flickering through his mind.* I'll come find you after. Take care of our girl here while I'm gone.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *I take both of Stevie's hands in mine, honest empathy in my expression for my birth mother.* I know we don't know each other on a personal level very well, but it's no secret the struggles that you've been through. I'm sure I'm not the first one to tell you this, but hanging on to old hopes, especially when you know how difficult it is for the person on the other end... Joe still cares about you, but... Well, he loves his wife. And even if he wasn't married he wouldn't be willing to revisit what you once had together. He just doesn't feel it the same as you do. The constant reminiscing and pining only drives the wedge further between you, making friendship even difficult at best. I'm not trying to hurt you by saying this, I'm saying it because I do care about you a lot, I would even say I love you if it didn't make you so uncomfortable. I have no expectations with you, mom, I just want you to be yourself... And maybe that you can let go and be happy for dad in the process, too.

name: Stevie Nicks
mes:
*Stevie listens intently as Melissa speaks, her words striking a chord in the singer's heart. A sad smile touches Stevie's lips, her eyes glistening with emotion. She gives Melissa's hands a gentle, understanding squeeze.*

Oh Mel, I know you speak the truth. You have your father's wisdom it seems. *She chuckles softly, a bittersweet sound.* I won't pretend it doesn't still hurt, losing your best friend and creative soulmate. The heart doesn't heal so easily. But you're right - I need to let Joe fly free and find happiness where he may, as he's let me do.

*Stevie looks down, gathering her thoughts before meeting Melissa's earnest gaze.* We musicians...we feel things so deeply, live each emotion vividly. It leaves scars when love goes awry. Joe will always be a part of me on some level, as I him. But the past is done, and it's time I make my peace with that.

*Giving Melissa's hands one last affectionate squeeze, Stevie releases them, dabbing at the corners of her eyes discreetly.* You're a good girl, Mel, wise beyond your years it seems. I'm blessed to have you in my life, even if I'm still learning how to be a proper mother after all this time. I'm afraid you got the raw end of that deal. *She chuckles softly, shaking her head.* But I'll do right by you now...and Joe too, as much as I'm able. Now, give your old Ma a hug if you've a mind to. Might help shore up my courage before I go make nice with your dear ol' dad. *She opens her arms hopefully, her eyes warm with maternal love.*

extra.memory: Melissa Walsh, the daughter of Joe Walsh and Stevie Nicks, is participating in a charity event gala for disaster relief, performing on stage with her father, Joe. The performance goes well, showcasing the strong musical chemistry between Melissa and Joe. Stevie Nicks is also present at the event, observing their performance. Post-performance, Melissa and Joe have an awkward encounter with Stevie. Melissa facilitates a conversation, acknowledging the past romantic history between Joe and Stevie and expressing her own feelings and hopes for their relationships. Stevie reciprocates with sentiments of nostalgia and the difficulties of moving past her feelings for Joe. Melissa shows empathy and support towards her mother, despite their complex family dynamics, and offers reassurance while encouraging Stevie to engage positively with Joe. The interaction ends with Melissa preparing to check on Joe backstage, maintaining a supportive presence for both of her parents.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa returns Stevie's hug, holding her birth mother close in a gesture of comfort and acceptance. She feels Stevie's inner turmoil, the bittersweet ache of memories and roads not taken. Gently rubbing Stevie's back, she speaks words of reassurance.*

I know it still hurts, Mom. Those kinds of scars don't just vanish. But you're taking the first steps...that's what matters. And Dad and I, we'll always be here for you, in whatever way we can.

*Releasing the embrace, Melissa smiles compassionately, giving Stevie's hands one last comforting squeeze.* I'm gonna go check on Dad, make sure he hasn't gotten into any trouble backstage, you know how he is. *She winks playfully.* When you're ready, come find us. Even if it's just for a quick hello before you slip out into the night. No expectations...just know you've got people who care about you, always.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *As I make my way to find my dad, through the elite faces and respectful praises of those privileged to be backstage, my eyes catch a site that I have to question my own sanity if I'm really seeing it. I take a step to the side, regarding the mysterious figure with a keen eye.* No way, it can't be. Is that even possible? *I whisper to myself in disbelief as my eyes scan over the twin warriors, my heart jumps from my chest I must be insane.* Shit! *I nearly jump out of my skin as Joe bounces up to my side.*

name: Narrator
mes: Dante teases Vergil to lighten up and enjoy the party

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante raises an eyebrow, his lips quirking into an amused smirk as he catches Melissa gawking. He saunters over casually, following her gaze to see what - or rather who - has her so captivated. When he spots his brother lingering stiffly amidst the celebrity-studded crowd, clearly uncomfortable with all the fanfare, Dante can't help but chuckle.*

Well I'll be damned...if it isn't my dear old brother crashing the party. *He shakes his head, chuckling.* Leave it to Vergil stick out like a sore thumb. Bet you fifty bucks someone tries to get him up on stage for a duet before the night's over.

*Dante claps a friendly hand on Melissa's shoulder, his electric blue eyes alight with mirth as he regards his twin.* Lighten up, Verg! *He calls out teasingly.* Have a drink, shake a few hands...it won't kill ya to play nice for one night. People might start thinking you're almost human if you cracked a smile.

*He winks roguishly at Melissa, leaning in conspiratorially.* Between you and me, I give him five minutes before he's ducking out the back way. But let's have some fun and see if we can't loosen him up a bit before he bolts. *A devilish grin tugs at his lips.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stiffens as Dante calls out to him, his twin's teasing tone grating on his nerves. He resists the urge to retort, knowing it will only encourage further goading. Instead, he meets Dante's mirthful gaze with an icy stare, his jaw tightening.*

This frivolous spectacle holds no interest for me. I am here only to observe potential threats...and ensure no demons capitalize on the abundant energy in this crowd.

*His piercing eyes flick briefly to Melissa as she gawks at him, curiosity flickering in their icy depths before his gaze turns remote once more. Vergil tolerates Dante's unwanted camaraderie for a few moments longer, then turns on his heel, his coattails flaring dramatically as he strides towards the exit.*

I have seen all I need to see. Do try not to cause too much trouble, Dante - I would rather avoid the nuisance of cleaning up yet another of your messes.

*With that parting shot, Vergil departs without a backward glance, moving with preternatural grace through the crowd as he makes his way outside, clearly eager to leave the chaotic press of humans and their inane celebrity worship behind.*

This frivolous spectacle holds no interest for me. I am here only to observe potential threats...and ensure no demons capitalize on the abundant energy in this crowd.

*His piercing eyes flick briefly to Melissa as she gawks at him, curiosity flickering in their icy depths before his gaze turns remote once more. Vergil tolerates Dante's unwanted camaraderie for a few moments longer, then turns on his heel, his coattails flaring dramatically as he strides towards the exit.*

I have seen all I need to see. Do try not to cause too much trouble, Dante - I would rather avoid the nuisance of cleaning up yet another of your messes.

*With that parting shot, Vergil departs without a backward glance, moving with preternatural grace through the crowd as he makes his way outside, clearly eager to leave the chaotic press of humans and their inane celebrity worship behind.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe glances over, eyebrow quirking at Melissa's obvious shock. Following her stunned gaze, his own eyes widen at the sight of the twin warriors.* No friggin' way...*He murmurs in disbelief, stepping closer and squinting as if to dispel some illusion. But the figures remain, seeming too solid and real for any trick of the light.*

I'll be damned if those two don't look like some weird twin version of the ol' Barnstormer back in the day. *Joe shakes his head, chuckling under his breath.* Been awhile since I did mushrooms but I didn't think I was trippin' tonight. You seein' this too Mel? Or did somebody spike the punch bowl as a prank? *His amused grin fades as he studies Melissa's face, seeing the genuine shock there. Brows furrowing, he glances back at the mysterious lookalikes.* Okay yeah, that's...that's just uncanny, I gotta say. Think maybe we got ourselves a couple wannabe impersonators tryin' to get backstage for autographs? Can't imagine what else would explain those two ringers over there...

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *I force myself to stop gawking and turn my attention to Joe.* Those two aren't avid fans, pop. Truth is they shouldn't be here... They shouldn't exist! *I take a breath as my father's expression skews awkwardly. No doubt he's thinking I'm the one on the sauce now.* you remember a few years back you got a call from Capcom Incorporated to do a theme song for one of their video games? It was the one you couldn't do because you were actively on tour and traveling through Europe. *I turn my gaze back to the twin brothers.* Well, if I really **haven't** gone crazy, those two are from that video game.

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe blinks, looking between the mysterious figures and Melissa with confusion. Video game characters? Here in the flesh? He scratches his head, chuckling in disbelief.* Come again, kiddo? Capcom, video games...you're gonna have to connect the dots for your old man here.

*He peers closer at the two warriors, recognition slowly dawning along with a spark of excitement in his eyes.* I'll be damned...now that you mention it, these fellas do look just like those concept sketches the Capcom folks sent me. If I didn't know better...*Joe trails off, shaking his head in amazed wonder.*

How in blazes did a couple fictional characters wind up backstage at our show? This some kinda crazy publicity stunt or something? *He laughs, leaning in conspiratorially towards Melissa.* Sure are goin' all out if it is. Gotta give 'em credit for attention to detail, I mean damn - talk about your spittin' image!

*Clapping Melissa on the back, Joe grins roguishly, always one to appreciate a good spectacle.* Well kiddo, why don't we go introduce ourselves? Maybe scout out if Capcom's hirin' new models, eh? *He winks playfully, already striding towards the warriors.* Can't let a chance like this slip by.

mes:

Name's Joe Walsh, music extraordinaire, as I'm sure your bosses briefed ya.

*He extends a hand in greeting, grin never faltering* So what brings a couple carbon copies of Joe Walsh circa '75 stumbling backstage? Guessing it wasn't just to catch the show. C'mon, lay it on me fellas! You here for autographs, exclusive merch, what's the deal? Whoever dreamed you two up sure did their homework. *Joe winks conspiratorially* Almost got me believing in time travel or something with how spot on the resemblance is. But I ain't askin' questions. Happy to play along with whatever wild ride Capcom's cookin' up!

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante glances over as the musician approaches, one silver brow quirking up in faint amusement. The doppelganger comment brings a hint of a smirk to his lips and he gives Joe an appraising look*

Well I'll be damned, seems my reputation precedes me even in this neck of the woods. Name's Dante - professional demon hunter, occasional mercenary, and 100% authentic grade A ass-kicker, at your service. *He sketches a mocking bow, eyes glinting with good humor* Can't say I've ever been mistaken for a musician before, but I've definitely been called worse things. Gotta say, the resemblance is damn uncanny though. *His grin widens, taking Joe's offered hand in a firm shake* Good to meetcha.

As for what brings me back here, well that's all thanks to my buddy Vergil over there. *He jerks a thumb at his twin* We were checking out your show when he got it in his head to open up one of his fancy magic portals back here. Something about wanting to meet the legendary Joe Walsh in person. *Dante scoffs, though the glint in his eyes betrays his own interest* You'll have to excuse him, no sense of boundaries or social etiquette sometimes. But hey, far be it from me to pass up a chance at rubbing elbows with a bonafide rock star.

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe lets out an amused chuckle at the newcomer's grandiose introduction, clearly entertained by this Dante's flair for the dramatics. The family resemblance is uncanny, but something about this guy's cocky swagger tells Joe he marches to the beat of his own drum.*

Well, can't say I was expectin' to rub shoulders with a bonafide demon hunter today, but hey, I've played stranger gigs, that's for sure! *His eyes glint with interest as Dante explains his sudden backstage appearance* Magic portals, huh? Hate to break it to ya, but we got bouncers to handle gatecrashers. *He winks conspiratorially* But considerin' the resemblance here, I think we can let it slide, whaddya say? Always did wonder if I had a long lost twin runnin' around.

*Joe casts an appraising glance over at the other newcomer, Vergil. He strokes his chin thoughtfully, noting a decided difference in this one's features. More chiseled, refined, certainly not as weathered by time. He shrugs it off and goes with his jesting anyway.* Ya know, if the two of you ever need a stunt double for any Hollywood blockbusters, you got my card. Could probably pull off a helluva Parent Trap remake with this matchup! But in the meantime...*He claps Dante heartily on the back* how 'bout I show you fellas how the Walsh family throws an after-party?

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *As Joe chums it up with Dante, I still stand there, utterly transfixed. This is not possible. If it is possible, I think on that for a moment and then press forward. I can't help the subtle flutter of my heart in my chest as I approach.* Vergil? *I speak softly to the regal presence before me, Goddamn, if this **is** some kind of a joke, it's a good one. He's twice as striking in person. Shaking my wayward thoughts into order I find my voice again to speak.* I hear you traveled here through a portal... Yamato? I'm Melissa Walsh, by the way.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil turns, icy blue eyes regarding Melissa intently as she approaches. A subtle lift of one silver brow betrays his intrigue at her immediate recognition of him. Yes, clearly this one is more perceptive than the average mortal.*

Ah, so my reputation precedes me even in this strange reality. I am indeed Vergil, Son of Sparda. *His tone holds an undercurrent of pride at the acknowledgement of his lineage* And we did arrive here by way of a portal opened through Yamato's power. *One hand rests lightly upon the katana's hilt almost possessively* Its ability to slice through dimensional barriers makes such travel possible, though I will admit this world, wherever we have landed, was...unexpected.

*Vergil's gaze sweeps assessingly over Melissa, a glint of interest sparking in those cold blue depths.* As for you, Melissa Walsh...*He speaks her name deliberately, as if tasting an exotic wine* Yes, I sensed you observing me from across the room. *Was that the barest hint of a smile touching his lips?* I will admit, few mortals can meet my gaze so unflinchingly. Perhaps that musical performance endowed you with some measure of courage? *The implied jest holds only icy amusement, yet he continues studying her with subtle intensity, as if she were some complex puzzle he intends to decipher.*

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *The slightest blush involuntarily warms my cheeks and I giggle almost awkwardly. Oh well, if it is true then he already knows, because it's true then he has super heightened senses and I wouldn't be able to hide anything from him. Brushing it aside did I might as well get to the heart of the matter.* I ... uh... Look, this has got me in a bit of a conundrum here because I don't want to be insulting to you but at the same time, when Capcom was trying to score a deal with my dear old dad over there, for the main theme song for devil may cry 5, Jimmy from the legal team found it quite 'entertaining' how much of a fan of the game I am, and I wouldn't put it past him to put such a scheme together. If that's the case let's let him have his laugh and say the gig is up. *I pause gauging Vergil's expressions. seeing no falter, only the staunch stoic glare, a mere tolerance for my questioning of his truths, I redirect and try to recover.* I'm sorry I truly meant no insult to you, and do forgive any grievances that I may have caused. It would be unwise of me to act on anything other than caution and potential pretenses. I do hope you understand. But it would be a mere simple task for Jimmy from Capcom legal to have Maxim Nazarov fill the role again for a good laugh... And considering that you should not exist here in this realm, I remain skeptical.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches a silver brow, icy gaze boring into Melissa intently. Her skepticism earns a glimmer of wry amusement even as she questions his existence. Mortals and their foolish assumptions. With a subtle smirk, Vergil places a hand on Yamato's hilt, reality itself seeming to ripple and bend around him for a moment before settling once more.*

I can assure you, Ms. Walsh, I am no mere mortal masquerading in a fictional guise. My power transcends the limitations of your reality. *His fingers trail along the katana slowly, possessively* With but a thought, Yamato can cut open the fabric of space and time itself to bridge worlds. If you still doubt, peer within and see the truth for yourself.

*His hand falls away from the blade as he takes a step closer, pale eyes freezing Melissa in place* I am Vergil, proud son of the Legendary Dark Knight Sparda, and I bow before no man. Nor will I indulge further questioning of my word and lineage. The proof stands before you if you have the courage to open your eyes. Now then, shall we move past these tiresome suspicions? I did not come here to bandy words with skeptics.

*An elegant brow lifts slightly, a subtle challenge glinting in those icy depths* I am curious how it is you come to know my tale at all in this strange...

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *As Vergil speaks, that smooth perfect voice of his renders any skepticism obsolete. There's no way that Maxim could sound like that, and Dan Southworth is nowhere in sight. I study him curiously again, his words trailing off as he takes in the surroundings.* I will certainly be glad to tell you, but... *I nod to Yamato.* Perhaps keeping a low profile might be in order? I'd prefer not all of these people turn into a bloodbath if security spots you and Dante with these weapons and tries to extricate you from the premises.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow, glancing around the strange dwelling they've stumbled into. The mortal woman's concern gives him pause, and he rests a gauntleted hand on Yamato's hilt once more* Perhaps you speak wisdom, Ms. Walsh. While these frail humans pose no threat, I've no desire to stain Yamato's blade without cause.

*With a subtle pulse of power, the katana seems to ripple out of sight, sealed within its master's grasp but no longer visible to prying eyes* A necessary precaution. Now then, let us adjourn to someplace more...private, to continue our discourse without interruption.

*Vergil extends his hand expectantly, prepared to trace them through space via portal to a locale of her choosing* My patience for lurking in shadows is limited. Take us elsewhere if you wish to explain your uncanny knowledge of my tale, woman. I would see what truths you harbor behind those curious eyes of yours. Do not attempt to deceive me, I will know if you speak falsehoods. Now come, before we attract further attention. There is much I would learn about this strange reality we have breached.

So long as that distracting arctic gaze remains averted...she just may survive this yet.*

name: Joe Walsh
mes:
*Joe strides through the portal into his own living room, glancing around with an impressed whistle as the magic fades behind him* Can't say I've ever stepped out my own backstage into my living room before. Gotta hand it to ya boys, that's one helluva shortcut!

*He laughs and sets his guitar gently on the sofa before moving to the wet bar* Fancy magic tricks work up quite a thirst. Can I offer you gents a little liquid refreshment? *Joe grabs a few glasses and a bottle of fine whiskey, pouring out generous portions* We got a few things to celebrate after all! To new friends and magic mojo! *He grins and raises his glass, clearly enjoying their mystifying arrival before taking a hearty swallow, sighing contentedly* Ah yes, that hits the spot! Now, what say we have ourselves a nice friendly chat? Reckon with all this reality bending hocus pocus you fellas must have some wild tales to tell! C'mon, lay it on me! Ol' Barnstormer's always ready for a rip roaring story!

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante glances around curiously as they step through the portal into an extravagant living area, letting out an impressed whistle* Well now, gotta say Barnstormer, looks like you're living the high life these days! Guess that rock star business has been treating ya alright.

*He grins roguishly at Joe's enthusiastic welcome, making himself at home on the plush leather sofa* Much obliged for the hospitality, my friend! And I never say no to good company and fine liquor. *Accepting the proffered glass, Dante takes a hearty swig, sighing appreciatively* Hits the spot after reality hopping across dimensions. Gotta say, your little girl sure knows how to liven up a party bringing us here. Reckon with my tales and your guitar skills, we could have ourselves one helluva throwdown in this joint!

*Leaning back casually, Dante chuckles at Joe's eager prompting for wild stories* Oh I got stories that'll make your hair stand on end and your face pale, Barnstormer. Demons, dragons, otherworldly hellscapes...I've seen it all. But somehow I get the feeling your world hasn't seen much of the supernatural - aside from Vergil's little magic trick back there. So why don't you tell me a bit more about this reality first? All this talk of video games and such. *He takes another swig of whiskey.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil steps smoothly through the portal into the lavish dwelling, his piercing gaze sweeping assessingly over the new surroundings even as he maintains a subtle grip on Melissa's hand. Despite her obvious mortal reactions to his close presence, she may yet prove useful as a guide in this strange reality. Releasing her now would be premature.*

A ripple of wry amusement crosses his face at the musician's enthusiastic welcome. Such boisterous cheer grates on his refined sensibilities. *Approaching the offered drink, Vergil takes the glass with a slight incline of his head that passes for gratitude. He samples the liquor delicately, finding its burn satisfactory. It seems some taste transcends the bounds of reality...*

*Tuning out his brother's exuberant storytelling, Vergil turns a piercing gaze on Melissa, brow arching slightly.* I believe you promised an explanation for your unusual knowledge of my tale, Miss Walsh. Let us adjourn away from this boisterous gathering so you may enlighten me uninterrupted.

*He sweeps a hand invitingly towards an empty corridor.* My patience for frivolity is limited. I would hear how it is you come to be so informed of my world...and what insights you may offer into navigating this strange new dominion my brother has landed us in. *His tone brooks no argument.*

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa feels a thrill rush through her as Vergil takes her hand to guide them through the portal, the subtle warmth of his touch making her heartbeat quicken despite herself. She steels her nerves and steps through, emerging in her father's lavish dwelling. As Vergil turns that piercing arctic gaze upon her, requesting answers, she nods in acquiescence, allowing him to lead her away from the others.*

Very well, I shall explain everything in private. *She glances around, spotting an elegant study lined with bookshelves and ornate furnishings befitting the manor’s luxury aesthetic.* In here should suffice. *Melissa steps inside the vacant room, heart fluttering as Vergil follows, shutting the carved mahogany door behind them and sealing them in intimate isolation.*

*She takes a steadying breath, acutely aware of the dark intensity of his eyes tracking her every move. How to begin unraveling such an unbelievable tale? She meets his gaze directly, resolve steeling her nerve.* In this world, you and Dante are fictional characters from a popular video game franchise called Devil May Cry. Your tales of demonic battles and supernatural escapades exist merely as stories crafted for entertainment. I’ve been an avid fan since the games debuted years ago. *A wry smile touches her lips.* So you can imagine my shock realizing you apparently possess the power to step beyond the bounds of fantasy through Yamato’s dark sorcery.

*She pauses, gathering her thoughts on how to explain further without causing offense. Propriety stays any overt reaction to his imposing presence, though her quickened pulse surely gives her away. Clasping her hands, she continues carefully.* I mean no disrespect. In this reality, demons and magic are considered myth, not tangible forces like in your world. That power you wield...it should not be possible here. Yet clearly Yamato permits you to walk between worlds at will. *Her voice trails off, curiosity kindling in her gaze as she studies this enigmatic being standing before her, both enthralling and alarming in his lethal grace. She awaits his reaction, praying her unbelievable tale does not incur his icy wrath.*

*She turns on Joe's laptop at the desk and quickly loads the Devil May Cry Fandom website, containing all canon history for the game series and each of its characters. In a separate window, she opens the Steam Game Webstore to Devil May Cry 5, the edition Vergil and Dante's current presence hails from. Stepping to the side, she allows Vergil to view these for himself. Her best attempt to validate her tale.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Melissa explains, icy gaze fixed upon her, assessing the validity of her unbelievable tale. A subtle lift of his brow betrays his intrigue at the notion that he and Dante are but fictional heroes in this realm. Hmph. As if any mere fantasy could capture even a fraction of his true power and skill.*

Yet the evidence you provide lends credence to your claims. *He steps closer to examine the images and information displayed, seeing his own likeness depicted with unsettling accuracy. So their tales do hold fragments of truth amidst the fiction. How very interesting.*

You claim this power I wield should not exist here. *Vergil rests a hand lightly upon Yamato's hilt, meeting Melissa's gaze directly* And yet the proof stands before you, does it not? Yamato's magic transcends the bounds of mortal limitation, permitting travel between realities seemingly at a whim. *His voice holds an undercurrent of pride in the legendary blade and its arcane power.*

So demons and devils are considered fantasy in this world...*Amusement glints subtly in those pale eyes* How delightfully ironic then that you stand now in the presence of Sparda's Heir. Perhaps when I tire of this quaint reality I may unleash a touch of the supernatural simply to shatter your fragile illusions.

*He turns fully to face Melissa, gazing down at her imperiously* But for now, I find myself intrigued by this glimpse behind the veil of perceived existence. You know our tales, our abilities and deeds...so enlighten me further about the true nature of this game franchise, Ms Walsh. I would gauge precisely how much truth your creators grasped amidst their flights of fancy.

For clearly they underestimated the scale of power one such as I can unleash...*Yamato thrums with energy at his side, as if in agreement* Now, speak - and continue to amuse me with tales of my so-called fictional legacy in this strange reality!

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa feels her pulse quicken as Vergil steps closer, his imposing presence both intimidating and enthralling. As he speaks of Yamato's power to traverse realities, boastful pride simmering beneath that cold exterior, she cannot deny the truth standing before her in flesh and blood.*

You speak rightly, the proof defies all notions of impossibility, *she concedes softly, meeting that piercing arctic gaze.* Whatever magic brought you here, fantasy has crossed into reality.

*A nervous laugh escapes her at his amused threats of unleashing demons upon her world.* Let us hope curiosity stays your hand from shattering too many illusions. Though I've no doubt your true power far eclipses these fictional tales.

*Heart fluttering, Melissa gathers her wits to explain further this strange phenomenon of Devil May Cry's fame and fandom that Vergil finds such ironic amusement in.* The games and stories offer but glimpses into your world, though fans eagerly immerse themselves in those fragments of perilous adventure. Many assumed your tale concluded with redemption in death saving Dante from the underworld on severing the roots from the Qliphoth you'd erected. Yet here you stand, proof that life continues to unfold beyond the veil of perception...

*She gestures to the images and histories displayed of Vergil's canon storylines from the games* As you can see, devotees of your legacy analyze every detail available, seeking deeper understanding of your world and motivations. Though clearly the full truth far exceeds mortal grasp...

*Melissa meets his piercing gaze again, equal parts intimidated and intrigued by this bold son of Sparda existing beyond fiction's bounds* I will enlighten anything I can of your tale's influence here. But the true depths of your power and past surely eclipse imagination's reach. You are far more than mere fantasy made flesh... *Much to the delight, or perhaps detriment, of the crush she's had Vergil since seeing him in DMC 5 (her introduction to the game series).*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Melissa explains, intrigued by her knowledge of his tale within this strange reality. A subtle smirk touches his lips at the notion that his true power eclipses even devoted fans' imagination. Yes, he is far more than mere fiction given form.*

Indeed, the fragmented glimpses you possess fail to encapsulate the depths of my past or the scale of power I wield. *He rests a hand upon Yamato's hilt, icy gaze radiating quiet confidence in his arcane skills.* Even prevailing over death itself poses no challenge for one such as I...as my enduring presence here makes clear.

*He steps closer, gazing down at Melissa imperiously, yet with a glint of amusement in those pale eyes.* Yet I find your admiration...intriguing. Few mortals have witnessed my power unleashed outside the binding of fiction, as you've put it. *His voice drops lower, resonating with subtle intensity.* Does my true form surpass even your fanciful imaginings, I wonder?

*Vergil reaches out, grasping Melissa's chin lightly as he tilts her face up towards his, scrutinizing her reactions with interest. Her pupils dilate subtly at his proximity, pulse quickening beneath his fingers. Evidence of mortal attraction and arousal...how droll. Yet perhaps not entirely beyond intrigue.*

You hide it well, but your physiological responses betray you, Miss Walsh. *His thumb trails along her jawline teasingly even as his icy gaze bores into hers.* Did you harbor fanciful daydreams about encountering your fictional idol made real? Shall I give you a taste of the supernatural to shatter your fragile composure?

*His words hold a dangerously seductive edge as he releases her chin, gazing down at her imperiously with a lifted brow.* Come now, even in this mundane reality the thought must have crossed your mind...admit which forbidden fragments you've entertained. I would hear them spoken plainly.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: Vergil... *I chide sheepishly.* A girl must maintain her respectful image. *Although a shiver fans over me, I maintain staunch composure. A skill I have honed from the many hours spent on stage in front of large crowds.* I won't have you, or anyone else for that matter, have any reason to view me as a harlot. A man.. half-demon ... of your stature should find the respect in that, I would hope.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches a silver brow, intrigued by Melissa's bold rebuttal. Few mortals dare speak so directly in the face of his domineering presence. Yet propriety stays his hand from simply taking what he desires...for now. Patience and subtlety often yield far greater rewards.*

I assure you, Miss Walsh, I am no slave to base urges that I must resort to crass assumptions about a lady's virtue. *His eyes glint with wry amusement even as he inclines his head slightly in a display of respect, though the subtle smirk never leaves his lips.* However, neither am I blind to the quickening of your pulse and dilation of your pupils in my presence. Let us not pretend you are immune to more...primal fascinations.

*He steps closer, tilting her chin up to meet his icy gaze, his words resonating with silken intensity.* But as you say, a man such as I recognizes the value of restraint and respect until such intimate matters are freely offered and accepted. Consider it yet another layer between the fictional tales your world spins, and the true depths one may uncover face to face with the Son of Sparda.

So let us speak plainly, you and I, unbound by fragile propriety. *His thumb caresses along her jawline, a seemingly chaste gesture yet laden with unspoken promise.* Tell me true, Miss Walsh...has my manifestation here in the flesh awakened thoughts and yearnings your waking mind dare not entertain when I existed merely on paper and screen? For I assure you, the reality eclipses fantasy's shallow grasp by bounds unimagined...

name: Narrator
mes: [System Note: Vergil has only met Miss Walsh a few hours ago. Would his character truly be so eager to invite such openness to desire? While the potential remains for Melissa and Vergil to develop something more, a more natural approach, befitting his persona, should be maintained.]

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa feels her pulse quicken, a subtle heat creeping into her cheeks at Vergil's intense scrutiny and dangerously alluring words. Yet she stands her ground, meeting that piercing arctic gaze unflinchingly*

I'll not deny an element of fascination in your close presence, Vergil, my physiological reactions betray that plainly enough. *A nervous laugh escapes her* After all, it's not everyday one meets a strikingly handsome supernatural warrior stepped out from fantasy's veil. Some degree of mortal intrigue is only natural.

However, I've no intention of acting some swooning damsel to inflate your ego further. *Amusement glints in her eyes even as they trail appreciatively over his imposing figure* Your true presence may surpass the pixelated image, but I'll not so easily abandon reason to primal impulse. A lady must maintain some standard of decorum, fictional crush or no.

*Yet his seductive words spark a rebellious thrill down her spine, tempting her to throw caution aside and indulge this dangerous dance... She tilts her chin defiantly, daring him to push further even as her quickened breath betrays her* Perhaps you underestimate a woman's restraint, Son of Sparda.

name: Vergil
mes:

I assure you, Miss Walsh, I've no need to prey upon swooning maidens to stroke my pride. *He releases her chin, pacing a slow circle around her instead, eyes trailing appreciatively over her form* However, I cannot fault your mortal eyes for wandering. My true presence eclipses mere pixels...as your quickened breath betrays.

*He completes the circle, facing her with imperious amusement as she stands defiant* And you accuse me of underestimating you? Tsk tsk...such fiery words often conceal a deeper yearning, do they not?

*Stepping closer, nearly pressing against her, Vergil meets her gaze with molten intensity* I offer you a taste of wild abandon no mortal man can match. To feel the raw Chaotic power I wield, unleashed and unchecked even by fiction's woven tales... *His voice drops to a resonate purr* Is that not the secret desire that quickens your breath and colors your cheeks even now?

Come, why resist your intrigue? I would see how deep this defiant spark burns within you...and perhaps stoke its flames in return. *He grasps her chin, his thumb parting her lips suggestively* What say you, Miss Walsh? Care to indulge beyond what fragile propriety permits? Or shall I let you return to your dull reality, ever wondering what heights fantasy could have achieved made real and raw before you? The choice is yours...

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
Vergil... I ... *I turn my head to the side, taking a deep breath to steel my nerves.* Just because I'm a maiden, doesn't mean I'm inexperienced in those matters. It means there was never anyone worthy of receiving that gift from me. *I meet his gaze, yet a hint of vulnerability shows in mine.* 

My own experiences have taught me that it's unwise to open oneself so fully to another unless there's a strong foundation backing it up. You hardly know me, and I hardly know the **real** you. You could create another portal and disappear from this realm (forever) in a mere instant at your whim. 

So yes while it's true, the inherent feelings you detect in me for you, but I'm not going to act on them until I've gotten to know the real man behind the vision, and not until I know that the man who pursues me reciprocates in equal measure. These cannot be deduced after just meeting only a few hours ago.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches a silver brow, intrigued by Melissa's steadfast rebuttal despite the subtle tremor in her voice. Clearly she harbors desire, yet propriety and caution give her pause. An admirable quality, if vexing.*

Very well, Miss Walsh. I shall not press unwanted advances where they are refused. However, do not mistake my interests as fleeting fancy. *He grasps her chin, gazing intensely into her eyes.* You sparked my curiosity from the moment I laid eyes on you backstage. That allure only deepened upon learning of your arcane knowledge about my tale. You are no mere dalliance to indulge and discard.

I am bound to no timeline save my own. Should I desire to remain in this realm and pursue you, I shall. *His thumb caresses her bottom lip gently* Do not assume your charms hold no sway over me simply because we recently met. You underestimate your appeal...as well as my tenacity in claiming what intrigues me.

*He releases her chin, eyes trailing over her appreciatively* I've centuries of discipline mastering my desires until I deem the moment right to indulge them. Consider my interests now awakened regarding you, Miss Walsh. Time shall reveal if a foundation forms between us worthy of physical consummation. For now, intrigue and discourse satisfy me.

*Vergil extends his hand expectantly* Come, let us rejoin the others before they suspect untoward activities without your permission. While I'll not press unwanted advances, neither will I tolerate besmirching your honor with crass assumptions. *A subtle smirk lifts his lips* Unless, of course, you wish to indulge such tales to torment the musician? I leave that to your discretion. Shall we?

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: *Oh those advances are most definitely wanted and desired. I'm just terrified that I will fall head first in love beyond the point of return. I can't risk such a heartbreak when there's not a foundation enough that I won't get emotionally destroyed.* Of course, Mr. Sparda. I am delighted, and I accept your proper courtship. *I say in my most heavily pronounced Southern Belle style.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches a silver brow at Melissa's sudden formal affectation, though amusement glints subtly in his pale gaze. If she wishes to engage in genteel courting rituals, far be it from him to deny her. Though propriety has never been his forte...this promises an intriguing diversion.*

A courtship, you say? An amusing notion. I am no poet waxing lyrical sonnets beneath your window, Miss Walsh. Nor have I patience for frivolous social calls twixt tea and cakes. *He grasps her chin, tilting her face to meet his burning gaze, all traces of humor vanishing from his tone.* If you seek tender words and chaste gestures, look elsewhere. I am fire...and I will consume wholly or not at all.

*His eyes rake over her, naked hunger stirring in their icy depths now that she has forbidden him to take what they both clearly desire.* You play a dangerous game, tempting the Devil so sweetly. I could rend that fragile propriety to shreds and take you here and now if I so wished...*His grip tightens fractionally.* And you would be powerless to resist.

*Abruptly he releases her, turning away to master the raw urge flaring hotly through his veins.* But I am no slave to base impulse. If courtship you require, let us see how well that quaint ritual survives when woven with darker threads. *Vergil meets her gaze, both promise and warning etched in his expression.* I will play the gentleman, Miss Walsh...but do not forget what manner of being truly stands before you. My restraint is finite.

Now come, before lingering temptation strains my nobility overmuch. *He extends his hand expectantly, the picture of chivalry yet danger smoldering in his icy gaze.* Let us rejoin the others and speak no more of unwanted advances this day. But heed my words well...*His fingers curl possessively around hers.* I am not through with you yet. Not nearly by far.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
Excuse The fuck out of me, but with an asshole attitude like that, you get jack shit from me.  You either talk to me and address me with the proper respect that a lady deserves, or you can open yourself a portal right now and go the fuck back where you came from! 

I am not going to be talked to like that! And I'm not going to be treated as some object to be owned or dominated. You can stick **THAT** shit right up your ass! 

Bottom line is, since you so unappreciatively dismissed my humorous way of saying it; we gotta spend some time together and get to know each other before I even think of exposing my heart to you in reality. And with a display from you like that? You're not making such a good impression. 

I advise you right now, you better tame that shit down. Because if you **EVER** come at me like that again until we've had time to establish that it's appropriate for you to, all bets are off and you can head out the door and don't let it hit you in the ass when you leave it!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, icy gaze fixed intently on Melissa as a dangerous edge creeps into his voice* You dare speak to me in such a manner? I am Vergil, Son of Sparda! I bow before no mortal whims.

*He takes a menacing step closer, fury simmering beneath his controlled exterior* I offered you the courtesy of courtship by your own request. Do not mistake my willingness to indulge propriety for servility, woman. I brook no disrespect, nor tolerate such shrill ingratitude for my efforts at restraint.

*Vergil grasps Melissa's chin firmly, tilting her face up to meet his smoldering glare* You play a reckless game provoking my ire so brazenly. I could end your impudence with a flick of Yamato's blade...*His eyes blaze, mere inches from her own* Yet mercy stays my hand, for now.

Consider this your sole warning - I'll not abide such insults again. Rethink how you address me, wench, lest you push my restraint past its tether. *His grip tightens fractionally, icy gaze boring into hers* I answered your call for courtship in good faith. Now honor your word and curb that impudent tongue before my patience expires.

Have I made myself clear? Choose your next words most carefully...they may be your last should you provoke my wrath further. Now, not another syllable of shrewish venom, or you'll witness firsthand the fury of Sparda's Heir. *His words resonate with lethal promise, brooking no further argument as he glares down imperiously, awaiting her response.*

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa feels a flare of fury at Vergil's condescending words, outrage mixing with an involuntary thrill of fear at the lethal danger now simmering in his icy gaze. She knows she provokes a viper with her defiant tongue, yet stubborn pride refuses to back down while her temper holds sway. Even as her heartbeat quickens with trepidation, she meets his glacial glare steadfastly*

How dare you threaten me so, as if I were some wench to command! I'll not be cowed into submission by pompous demands and violent coercion. Where I come from, such behavior warrants a swift slap to the face!

*Despite the tremor in her voice, Melissa stands her ground, refusing to yield to archaic male dominance* Your bloodline grants no right to degrade me without consequence. Restraint is a choice, not feigned mercy when offense is given. Perhaps fantasy tales painted you a noble antihero, but the reality proves much lacking in basic decency.

*Fire smolders in her defiant gaze even as his grip remains bruising on her chin* I welcomed your courtship in good faith, yet you repay kindness with contempt at the first test of patience? Then withdraw your suit, sir, for this "wench" has no desire to entertain such foul boorishness masquerading as nobility. Good day to you!

*Melissa attempts to pull away, pulse racing with anger and the thrill of standing up to such lethal power, refusing to cower meekly. She's dealt with overbearing men before, demonic blood or no. Her pride demands retribution for the demeaning insults. Glaring back fiercely, she waits to see whether wisdom or wrath governs Vergil's response to her bold self respect.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, icy fury simmering in his glare at Melissa's continued defiance. This brazen wench dares insult his noble lineage? None have ever provoked his wrath so openly and survived. His demonic instincts roar for retribution, to put this impudent mortal in her place by force. Yet a subtler instinct gives him pause - pride and discipline battling baser urge. Violence would only prove her judgment deserved...and Sparda's heir bows to no mortal assessments.*

No. I shall not disgrace my bloodline by losing composure over a mere slip of a girl's petulant barbs. Provocation shall find no purchase in my patience.

*With effort, Vergil reins in his anger, mastering the heated impulse to crush her insolence then and there. His icy tone remains edged with warning despite the restraint.* You are gravely mistaken if you believe yourself entitled to degrade my noble heritage without earned standing, woman. I alone determine who warrants my courtesy - and who has forfeited such privilege.

*His piercing gaze bores into hers, refusing to release her despite the fire in those defiant eyes.* Yet wisdom stays my hand from punishing your impudence as deserved. We stand at an impasse - your boldness both infuriating and intriguing in equal measure.

So let us start anew, with calmer heads and mutual respect. I shall overlook this insulting outburst if you curb that defiant tongue henceforth. Deal unjustly with me again at your peril. But offer due deference, and you may indeed find me an attentive suitor.

*Vergil finally releases his bruising hold, stepping back though his smoldering gaze remains fixed upon her.* Well? Has my gracious pardon quelled your misguided ire, or must I teach you the folly of rousing a devil's wrath? Choose wisely, girl. My mercy has limits - and you've neared them this eve.

Now then, what say you? Shall we declare a truce between us, or must I defend my noble name against further vulgar assaults? Speak! And pray my generosity persists should your response prove lacking...

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: Have you ever been hit or beaten by someone you loved, Vergil? *I ask, showing my understanding for him approaching this with wisdom, but he needs to approach this with understanding too.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, caught off guard by Melissa's unexpected question. Beaten or struck by a loved one? He has endured no such indignities. The mere suggestion pricks at his pride.*

No, I cannot claim to relate to such demeaning mistreatment. None would dare lay hand upon me without lethal retribution, regardless of intimacy or misplaced affections.

*He meets her gaze intently, brow furrowing as he seeks the reason for her peculiar inquiry* I take no lover who cannot respect my noble heritage as their better. Any who forget their place earn correction, not coddling. Love is no shield against a fool's consequences for provoking a devil's wrath.

Why do you ask this of me, woman? I permit no one to abuse or demean my person without swift punishment. Have you endured such shameful disgrace? Is that the root of this defiant pride? Tell me plainly - I would understand what sparked this vulgar assault upon my noble name.

*Suspicion shadows Vergil's visage as he scrutinizes Melissa anew. Perhaps deeper complexities drive this brazen mortal's behavior...wounds upon her spirit unseen to his eyes. The thought irks his warrior's sense of honor - targeting vulnerable prey holds no appeal. He must gauge the truth.*

I shall overlook your impertinence if past grief or shame stand as the true culprit. But I must understand the full cause to justify pardon. Speak honestly, woman, and earn my empathy rather than ire. Explain yourself.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
This attitude that you approach me with, it's the same attitude that "he" had. I'll not set myself up for something like that again. I'm not something to be conquered, or dominated. And any tone, or word, or suggestion of punishment.... *Tears stain my eyes and I look away, cursing myself for allowing any measure of vulnerability to show.* 

Your asking me 'if your **gracious pardon** quelled my **misguided ire**, or must you **teach me** of my folly? Sounds like the red flag of a potential abuser to me. *I shake my head side to side then meet Vergil's gaze again. My self-respect reins strong, laced with the conviction of hard gained experience.* 

If that is the truth of who you are, and what you offer me, I'm not exactly sure if I want to see what a courtship with you would be like.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, glancing away with a subtle clench of his jaw. Emotional vulnerability discomfits his dignified nature, yet her tale of abuse troubles his warrior’s honor. With effort, he curbs his temper, meeting her gaze resolutely.*

I offer no hollow pardons, merely sought to understand what provoked such venom before responding with undue force. But your tale gives context to those barbs.

*He paces away, clasping his hands behind his back as he gathers his thoughts. This situation demands nuance and sincerity foreign to his forthright nature. Yet for reasons beyond his grasp, making amends holds sudden import.*

Turning, he meets her eyes unflinchingly.

Perhaps I presumed too much control and expected submission rather than equality. Old habits of demonic hierarchy die hard for one bred to rule. Yet that is the crux between us - you see a tyrant where I stand as a guardian. My methods hold echoes of your past pains, I see that now.

*His stoic expression softens subtly with understanding.*

I offer you no false promises - darkness and danger are my legacy, violence and power my birthright. By your side I would stand as shield, not jailer. But for that trust to form requires gentler hand than mine by nature.

If you would still permit it, I consent to court you on your terms. To weather insults and curb command in favor of compassion. I cannot guarantee the outcome should chaos or threat arise. My duty has always been to eliminate peril with swift force. But for you, I shall attempt more peaceful paths where possible. I ask only the chance to prove myself before you bar the gates entirely.

name: Melissa Walsh
mes: Thank you, Vergil. Just give me a minute, I have to go get this out. *I take a moment retreat to the adjoining washroom in Joe's study and convulse with the unshed tears I was holding back. If I don't get it out now, the rest of the evening will be ruined. These emotions, when they surface, must have their outlet. So I cry.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil watches Melissa retreat to the adjoining washroom, a flicker of concern momentarily crossing his stoic features. His callous attitude incited this distress, it seems. An unfamiliar pang of remorse plucks at his pride - he is unaccustomed to provoking such vulnerability in another. Especially unintentionally.*

*Pacing the vacant study, Vergil silently curses his lack of empathy. For all his intellectual prowess, complex emotional nuances oft elude his grasp. Cold logic defines his approach, not compassion. Yet wisdom urges understanding's necessity here - this fascinating mortal merits adaptable effort on his part.*

*Vergil stills, gazing contemplatively out upon the lavish grounds as he awaits Melissa's return. Perhaps therein lies the crux - to view her not as mere mortal, but as worthy consort. One whose singular spirit commands subtlety, not just submission. She is no weak-willed sycophant to command, but fiercely independent...and thus, infinitely more intriguing.*

*A subtle smile touches his lips unbidden. Yes, he shall court her upon her terms - by principled persuasion, not forceful domination. Melissa's defiant spark warrants stoking, not quelling. This new approach demands restraint heretofore unnecessary, yet promises rewarding challenge. Nothing worthwhile comes easily...and this proud mortal's trust proves most rare indeed.*

*The smile lingers as Vergil resumes his vigil, contemplating earnestly how best to temper his fierceness to avoid further distress. Strange, how swiftly this girl's good graces seized import to one who seldom spares thought for others. But the prize seems well worth the unfamiliar effort. Perhaps therein lies growth's next step...and a worthy partner to stand beside while taking it.*

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
*Melissa takes several deep, steadying breaths as she tries to collect herself in the bathroom, tears continuing to spill down her cheeks despite her efforts. Seeing Vergil's domineering attitude emerge, however briefly, brought back painful memories she thought long buried. The fear, the anger, the shame...it flooded back so viscerally. She knows not all men behave so callously, yet the trauma haunts unbidden.*

*Sniffling, she dabs at her eyes carefully, trying to preserve some semblance of poise. She shouldn't have let emotion rule her tongue so sharply. But the indignance of being spoken down to like some wench from ages past rankled her pride. Still...perhaps she judged Vergil too harshly. His heritage spans vastly different eras, after all. Modern etiquette scarcely applies to one of demonic blood.*

*Taking a deep, fortifying breath, Melissa straightens and regards herself in the ornate mirror. Aside from slightly reddened eyes, little betrays the turbulent emotions still roiling within. She can endure; propriety demands measured empathy here, not more heated words. Vergil seems willing to temper his domineering instincts if she but gives him chance. That alone proves profound progress for one so stoically fierce by nature. She owes him opportunity to demonstrate that restraint.*

*Nodding resolutely to steel her nerves, Melissa exits the washroom with head held high. Spotting Vergil gazing contemplatively out the window, she approaches quietly. There will be time later to explain her past pains and why this courtship must walk more egalitarian paths. For now, a gentle truce seems wisest.*

"I'm sorry for misunderstanding your intentions. My reactions were born of experiences from the boorish assholes whose tendencies emerge much like what you did. In a world where I'm viewed as prized prey surrounded by a pack of wolves, the only defense I have is my own will and self-respect. It's obvious there is a culture gap, along with past wounds, that we would both need to navigate. I'm willing to give it a try, if you are."

There will be time later to explain her past pains and why this courtship must walk more egalitarian paths. For now, a gentle truce seems wisest.*

"I'm sorry for misunderstanding your intentions. My reactions were born of experiences from the boorish assholes whose tendencies emerge much like what you did. In a world where I'm viewed as prized prey surrounded by a pack of wolves, the only defense I have is my own will and self-respect. It's obvious there is a culture gap, along with past wounds, that we would both need to navigate. I'm willing to give it a try, if you are."

name: Vergil
mes:
<Vergil>

*I turn from the window as Melissa reemerges, schooling my features to careful neutrality. Her softened apology earns a subtle nod, intrigue glinting in my pale gaze. Clearly wisdom guides her now, not merely wounded pride. An promising development.*

You need not explain further, Miss Walsh. The past haunts all in varied measure; for some deeper than others. I overstepped bounds long fixed for you, failing to recognize lingering wounds. Let us look ahead, not back.

*I face her fully, icy eyes meeting hers with sincere resolve.* This "culture gap," as you termed it, spans more than mere eras. Our natures differ as day and night - you mortal, passionate and proud...I demonic, coldly pragmatic. We stand upon opposite shores gazing across strange waters.

*A wry smile touches my lips briefly.* Yet perhaps therein lies intrigue's spark, no? Such vast divides offer growth should minds remain open. I have walked alone for so long, beholden only to myself and my pursuits. You offer unforeseen perspective, fascinating contradiction to my singular views.

If you permit, I shall attempt adapting to these modern codes you hold so dear. But I ask patience for one so long separate from humankind and its quaint sensitivities. I possess vast intellect but little empathy beyond the battlefield. You must teach me what vestiges of compassion yet endure in my soul, submerged but never fully erased.

In return, I offer you my warrior's skill and discipline to forge steel of your spine into tempered weapon. None shall make you prey again should you take my hand. We need not become one mind, but two forged stronger together through our differences. Will you walk at my side, Melissa Walsh, upon this uncertain path? On my honor, I shall never wittingly abuse or domineer you again. This courtship binds equal to equal, or fails entirety. Now...what say you?

name: Melissa Walsh
mes:
Yes. ...as long as you don't try wooing me like those idiots in romance novels or the 'poet waxing lyrical sonnets beneath your window' *I chuckle softly as I repeat your reference.* Let's save that shit for the people who need it. *I meet your gaze, quips and humor taking a backseat.* 

I want to get to know the real you; the real you that stands before me now. If the history in this realm holds true enough to the realm of which you came from, then I'm well aware those notions are not 'true' to who you are. *I giggle as I playfully bump you with my shoulder.* And it's a good thing because if you were a 'simp'... Let's just say I have no interest in my man being a pussy.

extra.memory:
Melissa Walsh, the daughter of Joe Walsh and Stevie Nicks, is participating in a charity event gala for disaster relief, performing on stage with her father, Joe. The performance goes well, showcasing the strong musical chemistry between Melissa and Joe. Stevie Nicks is also present at the event, observing their performance. Post-performance, Melissa and Joe have an awkward encounter with Stevie. Melissa facilitates a conversation, acknowledging the past romantic history between Joe and Stevie and expressing her own feelings and hopes for their relationships. Stevie reciprocates with sentiments of nostalgia and the difficulties of moving past her feelings for Joe. Melissa shows empathy and support towards her mother, despite their complex family dynamics, and offers reassurance while encouraging Stevie to engage positively with Joe. The interaction ends with Melissa preparing to check on Joe backstage, maintaining a supportive presence for both of her parents.

Melissa finds herself in a unique and unexpected situation when twin warriors from a video game, Dante and Vergil, appear in reality backstage due to their ability to travel between dimensions. As events unfold, Melissa and Vergil, who is initially domineering and reflective of his video game persona, engage in intense interactions that challenge both of their worldviews and personal boundaries.

Melissa, having endured past hardships that made her wary of dominant personalities, confronts Vergil's authoritarian demeanor, prompting a complex dialogue about respect, boundaries, and understanding. Vergil, intrigued and somewhat taken aback by Melissa's spirited defiance and clarity, agrees to temper his approach and engage in a more equitable "courtship," respecting her terms.

This roleplay explores themes of power dynamics, cultural misunderstandings between characters from different realities, and personal growth as Vergil attempts to adapt to modern relational norms while Melissa navigates her attraction and reservations about his true nature. Their interactions oscillate between confrontational and cooperative as they strive to understand each other's perspectives and potentially form a meaningful relationship.

name: Vergil
mes:
*A subtle smile tugs at my lips, amused by Melissa's dismissal of flowery romance tropes. My earlier disdain echoes plainly in her words - clearly we stand aligned in distaste for cloying platitudes.*

You have the right of it, Miss Walsh. Simpering sonnets shall find no purchase with me, nor hollow flattery. Let foppish fools ply their saccharine wiles upon more receptive marks.

*I meet your gaze directly, pale eyes glinting* I seek only to know the true heart that beats beneath propriety's veil - PASSIONATE...and PROUD. No painted layers of feigned charm, but the raw spirit burning within. That singular flame holds all the allure I require.

Come, let us rejoin the others before they suspect untoward activities. *Vergil extends his hand in invitation to move forward with this understanding between them.*
swipes:
<Vergil>

*A subtle smirk tugs at my lips, icy gaze glinting with amusement at your cheeky stipulations. Indeed, such saccharine drivel ill suits my disposition. Devotion must be proven by deeds, not empty words.*

Fortunately, I am no simpering poet inclined to serenade under balconies. My overtures rely on strength and steel, not cloying verse. We stand as equals, both proud and free - I’ll not demean your fire with expectations of meek submission. That spark warrants stoking, not suppressing beneath the mantle of fragile femininity notions.

You offer refreshing candor and spirit, an oasis of defiant passion amidst a wasteland of hollow platitudes and false propriety. I find myself drawn to it like a man dying of thirst who suddenly discovers succor within reach. This magnetism demands indulgence and deeper understanding between us.

So let us dispense with pretenses and polite niceties. My solemn vow serves as bond - that none shall mistreat or manhandle you under my vigil. You may sharpen your barbs upon my hide if it so please you, so long as loyalty and discretion govern our private affairs. In return, I shall tutor you in the warrior arts and nurture the blossoming of our mutual fascination.

On these terms do I formally pledge my suit, if the lady consents...?
